intro: Bistorta albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered bistort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like sorrel and buckwheat. The plant features upright, rhizomatous stems that bear alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish or purplish underside. Its showy white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters at the ends of the stems, typically in late spring to early summer. Bistorta albiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
